title: Otter Browser aims to bring Chromium to decades-old OS/2 operating system
content:
Every computer needs a capable web browser, but that’s easier said than done on computers running something besides Windows, macOS, or Linux. There are still a few people using the OS/2 operating system, which was created by Microsoft and IBM and ended mainstream development in 2001, and is in desperate need of a functional web

The post Otter Browser aims to bring Chromium to decades-old OS/2 operating system appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Otter Browser, a Chromium-based web browser for the 20 year-old OS/2 operating system, is nearing release after years of development.
